ratings.question_text: What is your overall assessment of this course?

narratives.question_text: How would you summarize AFAM 505 01/AMST 643 01 for a fellow student? Would you recommend AFAM 505 01/AMST 643 01 to another student? Why or why not?
comments: Take it if you have a very specific research goal in the period. For a general overview of the period, you would be better served by something less research oriented and less fragmented.

i would recommend english 971 01 to two types of students: those without particular background in the field looking for a broad overview of english modernism, AND those with a good background looking to do intensive research in on an understudied figure or movement.

Absolutely! The readings are excellent (and students have a lot of say in what texts are read), Professor Lewis is a fantastic teacher, and the smaller discussion/project groups actually allow you to have REAL conversations about literature, as opposed to awkward and artificial discussions that pervade most seminars.

I would recommend it for someone who wishes to cover or at least, get a taster for many aspects of this period, and also for those who have worked or wish to work on more specific texts from the period whilst also fitting them in to a broader context of the era as a whole.

narratives.question_text: How did this course deepen your knowledge of your discipline/profession? To what extent did this course contribute to your dissertation/research?
comments: Definitely expanded my knowledge of the period and allowed me to explore a few texts deeply. I do wish we'd done more in depth with fewer texts.
learned a lot about aspects of modernism pertinent to prospective dissertation themes.
